class_notes:
(Permission of Instructor Required Prior to Enrollment)


Students must obtain permission numbers to enroll from the Advising Support Center (oxadvising@emory.edu).


Synchronous class attendance required; Timed, synchronous assessments and asynchronous assessments; Technology required: Google apps, webcam and microphone, and the ability to scan written work.
course_description: The course emphasizes the structure & function of the human body & uses a systemic approach incorporating both anatomy & physiology. NRSG 201 includes a survey of body tissues & muscular, skeletal, & nervous systems. Labs involve dissection, study of human specimens, & basic experiments in physiology. Four hours of lecture & one three-hour laboratory per week. The course fulfills requirements for admission to nursing schools & many allied health programs. The course does not fulfill requirements for medical & dental schools or biology major.
